intro: Keraselma provinciale, commonly known as the Provincial Kerash, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its flowers are small and white, with a subtle fragrance, and it blooms during late spring to early summer. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and is protected in several countries.
